review_blob:
1. Look  A deep gold color ale with a small white head.
2. Sniff  This ale has a dark bready aroma with notes of raisins as well
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale has a strong toffee flavor.
4. Another Look  This is a good looking ale with good lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this flavorful ale is easy to drink and has a smooth finish.  I would recommend this ale to those who enjoy a darker ale with complex flavors.

1. Look  A deep gold color ale with a small white head.
2. Sniff  This imperial india pale ale has big citrusy hop aroma.
3. Sip  This medium light bodied ale has an enormous hop taste that has a bitter dry finish.
4. Another Look  This is an average looking IPA with weak lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this very hoppy ale is made for those who enjoy the india pale ale style. I particularly enjoy the variety of hops used in the ale to create a bold and bitter flavor.  I would only recommend this imperial india pale ale to those who enjoy hoppy ales.
beer_name: Rogue XS Imperial India Pale Ale (IPA)

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob:
1. Look  A black color stout with a small brown head.
2. Sniff  This imperial stout has a somewhat chocolaty nose and with a licorice aroma as well.
3. Sip  This full bodied imperial stout has a warming mouth feel with a big chocolate flavor that has a dry bitter finish.
4. Another Look  This is an average looking imperial stout with a small short lasting head and no lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a heavy beer to be enjoyed during the winter months.  The alcohol is disguised well.  This imperial stout is a bit sticky and thick indeed.  I would only recommend this imperial stout to those who enjoy the style and work towards bigger beers such as Big Eddy.
beer_name: Leinenkugels Big Eddy Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob:
1. Look  A hazy amber-brown color ale with a large frothy off white color head.
2. Sniff  This is ale has a caramel aroma with a noticeable hoppy nose.
3. Sip  This medium bodied red ale is full of malty flavors, but has a crisp hoppy taste as well.  Also, there is a significant amount of sediment in this ale giving it a hearty characteristic.  There is a subtle grapefruit finish with hints of pine also.  
4. Another Look  This is an excellent looking red ale and has excellent lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is my new favorite red ale.  It has a sweet malty taste with a bold hoppy backbone.  I would strongly recommend this ale to those who enjoy easy-to-drink ales.  This unfiltered ale is a well-crafted and offers plenty to those seeking more from their beers.

1. Look  A deep brown imperial stout with a small tan head.  Also, there is plenty of sediment visible as well.
2. Sniff  This imperial stout has strong chocolate and toffee aroma.
3. Sip  This full bodied stout has a chewy taste and a smooth wet finish.
4. Another Look  This is a good looking heavy thick stout, but does not have lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this imperial stout is easy to drink and has several pleasant roasted malt flavors.  I especially like the amount of sediment in the stout as well.  I would recommend this imperial stout to those who enjoy dark chewy stouts.

1. Look  A pale gold IPA with a medium white head.
2. Sniff  This IPA has an orange citrus nose with a malty aroma.
3. Sip  This light bodied IPA is more like a pale ale in flavor and taste.  It is not very hoppy and has a bland overall flavor.  
4. Another Look  This is a average looking ale, but has above average lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this IPA that is not worth trying.  It is an average IPA at best with no unique differentiating qualities.

1. Look  An amber-brown color ale with a slightly tan head.
2. Sniff  This dark ale has a big citrus aroma with roasted malt notes as well.
3. Sip  This full bodied dark ale is very complex.  It has characteristics of brown ale, but also a citrusy hoppy flavor as well.  Also, the roasted malt flavors make this a very flavorful ale.
4. Another Look  This is a good looking ale, with weak lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a different ale in many regards.  This complex dark ale is full of flavor and has characteristics of a brown ale and IPA.  This combination of styles makes for an interesting ale that disguises the alcohol well.  I would recommend this ale to those who enjoy brown ales, harvest ales, or hybrid style ales in general.

1. Look  A hazy pale amber color ale with a large long lasting white head.
2. Sniff  It has a big citrus nose.
3. Sip  This medium bodied IPA is bitter.  It has a dry long lasting grapefruit finish with some woody notes.
4. Another Look  This is a good look IPA with good lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is not particularly my favorite IPA.  It is average in many aspects, however, it I would recommend this IPA to those who enjoy a hoppier and bitter ale.

1. Look  A somewhat hazy pale amber color IPA with a medium head that sparkles a bit.
2. Sniff  It has a citrusy hop nose with some a subtle piney aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied IPA has a strong bitter taste from start to finish.  It also has a long bitter dry finish.
4. Another Look  This IPA is an above average ale with average lacing and good carbonation. 
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is an assertively bitter IPA that only bitter ale drinkers would enjoy.  It also has a woody taste that is noticeable towards the backend.  I would only recommend to serious IPA fans interested in a big bitter beer.

1. Look  A black color imperial stout with a small tan/brown head.
2. Sniff  This imperial stout has subtle alcohol nose with coffee aroma and a lot of roasted malt notes as well.
3. Sip  This full bodied imperial stout has a warming mouth feel with a licorice flavor and smooth dry finish. 
 Another Look  This is an average looking stout with a small head and no lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a heavy imperial stout, but it not as tasty in comparison with other imperial stouts.  It has both a sweet and sour taste and numerous other flavors that make this imperial stout complicated and less enjoyable.  I would only recommend to those looking for a untraditional example of the style.

1. Look  A black color stout with a large frothy brown head.
2. Sniff  This imperial stout has a intense chocolaty nose and roasted malt aroma as well.
3. Sip  This full bodied stout has a warming mouth feel with a bold chocolate flavor that is mildly sweet.  Also, there is a soft bitterness finish and alcohol taste, but for the most part the alcohol is disguised well. 
4. Another Look  This is an excellent looking stout with a long lasting head and great lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a great beer for the winter months.  It has a many bold flavors and packs a punch.  I would absolutely recommend this stout to those who can enjoy and appreciate huge beers and are fans of the imperial stout style.  I think I may have found a go to imperial stout for the foreseeable future.

1. Look  A very clear pale gold color lager with a solid white head and lots of bubbles.
2. Sniff  It has a bready nose and a soft presence of alcohol.
3. Sip  This light bodied lager is tasty.  There is big malt flavor with a crisp finish.
4. Another Look  This is lager has good carbonation and a solid lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a very enjoyable lager that is easy to drink and would pair well with lighter foods.  I would absolutely recommend to the average mainstream lager drinkers for a change of pace.  This is absolutely a lager I will be picking up again soon.

1. Look  A very clear pale amber color ale with a solid white head and lots of bubbles.
2. Sniff  It has caramel and toffee aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale is tasty.  It a malty ale with a big caramel flavor with some toffee as well and a smooth finish.
4. Another Look  This is a good looking ale with a strong lacing and a long lasting head.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a easy drinking ale that could easily be a gateway for non-craft beer drinkers to enjoy other craft beers.  It has a pleasant malty finish with many refreshing qualities.  I would absolutely recommend to family and friends and especially non-craft beer drinkers.

1. Look  A very clear medium amber color IPA with thick medium white head.
2. Sniff  It has balanced nose, but it also has a subtle spicy hop aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale is different than mainstream IPAs.  It is more focused hop presence from start to finish.  Also, this IPA has a wet long lasting malty finish a trait that is not characteristic of IPAs.  
4. Another Look  This is without question one of the most attractive and good looking IPAs or even ale for that matter, I have come across.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this IPA has some unique characteristics that make this ale standout out.  It has a taste that says its from the mountains of Montana.  I would strongly recommend this IPA to others even those who are not fans of the style.  Big Sky IPA is a easy drinking, fun, and quite possibly the best looking ale I have come across.

1. Look  A very clear deep gold color pale ale with thick medium white head.
2. Sniff  It has malty nose with a fruity hop aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale is truly an English-style ale.  It has a sweet malty flavor and a somewhat soft, wet, and fruity hop finish.  
4. Another Look  This is great looking ale, with strong lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this ale reminds of the ESB style with its subtle fruity aroma and taste.  I would recommend to family and friends who do not like hoppy ales, but enjoy an easy to drink pale ale.
beer_name: Big Sky Scape Goat Pale Ale

review_blob:
1. Look  A medium amber color IPA with a small white head.
2. Sniff  It a big caramel malt nose with a citrusy and piney hop aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied IPA is initially sweet upfront and has a piney and grapefruit finish that is long lasting. This IPA has a more interesting hop flavor in comparison to other mainstream IPAs and it has a more dry taste as well.
4. Another Look  This is average looking IPA with weak lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a very enjoyable IPA.  I particularly like this IPA because it has a beginning, middle, and end which keeps me interested in this ale.  I would recommend this IPA to family and friends because it is a tasty and easy to drink ale for those who enjoy dry and mildly bitter IPAs.

1. Look  A brown color ale with a medium brown tan head.
2. Sniff  It has a very fruity nose and aroma.
3. Sip  This full bodied ale is very malty and has a somewhat apple taste.
4. Another Look  This is an average ale with weak lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this malty ale with a fruity yeasty flavor and the alcohol is disguised well.  I would not recommend this ale to my family and friends only those who enjoy Belgium ales.

1. Look  A deep amber color ale with a large frothy white head.
2. Sniff  It has very hoppy and citrusy nose.
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale is among the best of ales.  It has a sweet malty taste that has a smooth mild grapefruit finish.  It also is somewhat earthy and has subtle toasted notes that come through in the finish.
4. Another Look  This is great looking ale with a deep amber color and great lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a outstanding ale.  Its citrus nose and grapefruit finish give this ale a great taste.  It is not a bitter as the Northern Hemisphere Ale, but it is very easy to drink and bursting with flavor.  I would definitely recommend this wet-hopped ale to those who enjoy harvest ales and IPAs.  This ale will keep you interested from start to finish.

1. Look  A pale amber color IPA with a big frothy white head.
2. Sniff  It has malty nose with a hoppy citrus aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied IPA is somewhat sweet with a mildly bitter taste.  It is a very easy drinking IPA.
4. Another Look  This is a good looking ale that has great color and lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a representative example of the IPA style.  It is tasty ale that has a big malt body and soft bitter finish.  I would recommend to my family and friends and those who are starting to try IPAs.

1. Look  A black beer with a small brownish color head.
2. Sniff  It has a roasted chocolate nose with a very subtle cherry aroma.
3. Sip  This full bodied stout is very interesting.  At first sip, it is very similar to a regular stout, but it has a somewhat tart and sour cherry finish.  
4. Another Look  This is an average looking stout with average lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a very interesting stout.  However, its cherry flavor is intense and unexpected.  I would recommend this cherry stout to those who enjoy dark sour beers or stouts that are slightly different.

1. Look - A black beer with a small tan head.  2.  Sniff - It has a big roasted chocolate aroma.  3.  Sip - This full bodied stout is very smooth, swet, and creamy.  4. Another Look - This is a good looking stout with above average lacing.  5.  Evaluate - Overall, this is a very enjoyable stout.  It has a sweet creamy taste with a mild dry finish.  I would absolutely recommend to my family, freinds, and especially those who only drink Guinness.

1. Look  A hazy deep amber brown ale with a medium tan head.
2. Sniff  It has a very citrusy almost fruity aroma with notes of pine as well.
3. Sip  This medium to full bodied ale taste like Christmas.  It has a soft well balanced malt taste with a soft bitter piney hop flavor and a smooth wet finish.  Also, there is a very subtle fruity taste underneath the piney hop flavor.
4. Another Look  This ale looks good with average lacing and a somewhat long lasting head.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is most definitely a Christmas ale.  It smells and tastes like a Christmas tree.  It a very well crafted ale that would appeal to any beer drinker.  I would recommend this ale to my family and friends especially around Christmas time.

1. Look  A very clear medium amber color Double IPA with a large off white head.
2. Sniff  It has a very big citrus and almost fruity aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale is extremely tasty.  It is a well balanced Double IPA that is bursting with flavor from start to finish.  It has a citrusy taste followed by a grapefruit finish that is somewhat dry.
4. Another Look  This is dark amber color Double IPA looks great and has awesome lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a well crafted Double IPA that is a perfect balance of malt and hops. It is somewhat easier drinking than other Double IPAs with is caramel notes that are well balanced with a mild bitter grapefruit finish.  I would recommend this Double IPA and Sam Adam fans.  It is full of flavor with all the hops Double IPA drinkers are seeking.
beer_name: Samuel Adams Third Voyage Double IPA

review_blob:
1. Look  A medium amber color lager with a small short-lived white head.
2. Sniff  It has a very malty aroma. 
3. Sip  This medium bodied Oktoberfest is more bitter than expected, but it has a smooth malty taste with a somewhat long lasting metallic finish.
4. Another Look  This is Oktoberfest is average looking at best with no lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is an average Oktoberfest that has a mild bitterness to it.  It is very easy to drink and would pair well with traditional Oktoberfest foods.  I would recommend trying this Oktoberfest to fans of the style and others who enjoy some bitterness in Oktoberfest beers.

1. Look  A medium amber color IPA that looks very tasty and pours a small white head.
2. Sniff  It has a somewhat floral aroma and citrusy nose.
3. Sip  This full medium bodied ale is bursting with a freshly hopped flavor that is fruity initially followed with a soft bitterness and dry finish..
4. Another Look  This is a good looking ale that has solid lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is one of my favorite seasonal ales.  I love the fresh hop aroma and taste.  This is a classic ale in my book.  I would strongly recommend this ale to family and friends who enjoy IPAs.

1. Look  An amber brown ale that has a lot of sediment and pours a medium tan head.
2. Sniff  It has a very malty nose with a very subtle citrus aroma.
3. Sip  This full bodied red ale has a big malty taste that has a spicy dry finish.  Also, there are some piney wood flavors that linger that complement the big malty taste.
4. Another Look  This is a good awesome looking red ale.  It has a lot of sediment and a great lacing.    
5. Evaluate  Overall, this tasty red ale that would make a great pairing with food.  It is very easy drinking and it has a malty flavor with a soft woody taste that make this a really enjoyable ale.  I would definitely recommend this red ale loaded with hops to family and friends.

1. Look  A ruby brown ale that looks very tasty and pours a small off white almost tan color head.
2. Sniff  It has a chocolaty coffee like aroma whit some roasted malt notes as well. 
3. Sip  This full bodied ale has a roasted malty flavor that is fairly intense leaving long lasting coffee and chocolate taste.  Additionally, this ale has a smooth, wet, and light hop taste that is very tasty.
4. Another Look  This is a good looking ale that has weak to average lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is an interesting ale.  It has plenty of roasted chocolate and coffee flavors with a stronger hop taste than most brown ales.  I would recommend this to fans of porters, stouts, and heavy brown ales.

1. Look  A very clear deep amber brown ale with a big off white head and very good carbonation.
2. Sniff  This harvest ale has a fresh hoppy aroma with a big citrus and very soft piney nose.
3. Sip  This full bodied harvest ale is exceptional.  It has an initial sharp bitterness followed with very dry grapefruit finish.  
4. Another Look  This is one of the best ale I have ever seen.  It has a very long lasting head with excellent lacing and it deep amber colors make this beer stand out.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this harvest ale is outstanding.  It has great citrus aroma and a clean bitter finish that is long lasting.  I would strongly recommend this harvest ale to Centennial and Cascade hop fans.  This well crafted ale is an excellent opportunity to taste wet hops right from the bine.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Wet Hop IPA - Northern Hemisphere

review_blob:
1. Look  A pale amber IPA with a frothy white head and good carbonation.
2. Sniff  It has a very citrusy nose with a somewhat fruity aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied IPA has a mild orange peel flavor with soft bitter finish.  Also, there is almost a bubble gum flavor aftertaste that is very subtle.
4. Another Look  This IPA has a long lasting white head with very good lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is IPA is well balanced with a tasty malt character and a citrusy aroma and flavor.  I would recommend this IPA to anyone who enjoys IPAs but also those who enjoy mildly bitter ales with a big citrus flavor.

1. Look  A black color stout with a small brown head.
2. Sniff  It has a significant alcohol nose with a deep chocolate aroma.
3. Sip  This full bodied stout is sweet and full of flavor.  It has a deep roasted malt and chocolate taste with a very smooth finish.  There is a faint alcohol after taste, but the long lasting chocolate overtones help balance this big stout.
4. Another Look  This is black stout look heavy with not much lacing but tasty nonetheless.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a big stout that conceals its high alcohol content with its sweet chocolaty taste.  Also, its smooth finish and rich chocolate flavor make this an awesome stout.  I would absolutely recommend to Guinness drinkers and fans of the chocolate stouts as well.  This is a well crafted stout worthy of picking up again soon.

1. Look  An opaque medium amber IPA with an average white head.
2. Sniff  It has a citrusy and almost fruity aroma.  
3. Sip  This medium bodied IPA has interesting flavor but it also has a slightly undesirable after taste (may not be as fresh as expected).  Initially, there is a mild bitterness, followed with a big malty middle, and a mild bitter finish.  
4. Another Look  This looks like a tasty with somewhat long lasting head and above average lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this IPA is not particularly exciting.  There is a large malt flavor that is not balanced with hops.   This IPA more resembles and American Pale Ale  rather than an IPA.  I would not recommend this IPA to family or friends.

1. Look  A clear medium amber IPA with a large off white head.
2. Sniff  It has a big citrus and somewhat piney aroma that almost stings your nose.
3. Sip  This medium bodied IPA is different. It has a powerful citrus orange-peel taste with a big piney and grapefruit finish.    
4. Another Look  This is an appealing IPA with its medium amber color, excellent lacing, and a long lasting head.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this IPA definitely stands out.  I appreciate this IPA for its interesting bold flavor combinations it works well.  I would recommend this to the adventurous IPA drinker looking for a change of pace but still enjoys a higher IBU rating along with a fruity attitude.

1. Look  A clear medium amber pale ale with a small off white head.
2. Sniff  It soft malty and somewhat grassy nose with a delicate hop aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied pale ale has a grassy taste with a mild bitter finish that is fairly dry.   
4. Another Look  This is an average looking pale ale with weak lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is an average pale ale with a grassy taste and a dry mildly bitter finish.  I would not recommend this pale ale to family or friends.
beer_name: Horny Goat Hopped Up n Horny Pale Ale

review_blob:
1. Look  A clear medium amber color Octoberfest with a very small white head.
2. Sniff  It has a big malty aroma.
3. Sip  This is medium bodied Octoberfest is full of flavor.  It has a tasty roasted malt flavor that is perfectly balanced with very delicate hop bitterness.
4. Another Look  This is an average looking Octoberfest with no lacing, but it has an excellent amber color that will keep you interested.
5. Evaluate  Overall, Staghorn Octoberfest is a delicious and very drinkable lager.  I particularly enjoy the sweet long lasting roasted malt flavor.  I would absolutely recommend this lager to everyone.

1. Look  A very clear pale amber color IPA with a nice off-white head.
2. Sniff  It has a very subtle citrus nose, but mostly cedar and pine aromas are most noticeable. 
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale has a interesting flavor including cedar and pine notes followed by a mild bitter finish.
4. Another Look  This IPA looks very tasty.  It has average lacing with a long lasting head.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is unique IPA that has a great flavor and taste.  It is an easy drinking IPA that will keep anyone drinking it interested.  I would absolutely recommend this IPA to family and friends.  Dogfish Heads take on the IPA style is one to enjoy.

1. Look  A deep medium amber color ale with a nice white head.
2. Sniff  It has a great aroma that has a soft fruity nose.
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale with a dry bitter finish.  This is an excellent example of an American ESB.  It is not overly fruity, but has a pleasant bitter finish.
4. Another Look  This is a very appealing ale.  It has a great color with good lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a tasty ale that has a fruity nose and a bitter finish.  I really enjoyed this American ESB and I would definitely recommend this ale to others who enjoy a bigger bitter finish than most ESB.

1. Look  A bark brown ale with a brown foamy head.
2. Sniff  It has a smoky nose with a light roasted aroma.
3. Sip  This full bodied ale has a smoky smooth taste with a very soft bitter finish.
4. Another Look  This is a good looking ale with average lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a very tasty brown ale that is full of smoky flavors with a smooth bitter finish.

1. Look  A pale amber color ESB with a medium head.
2. Sniff  It has a very fruity nose with some malty notes.
3. Sip  This medium bodied ESB has a big fruity flavor and taste.
4. Another Look  This is ale looks good, but it does not have good lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this ESB is very fruity and has a smooth finish.  I would only recommend this ale to ESB drinkers that enjoy a deep fruity flavor.

1. Look  A deep gold color ale with a large white head.
2. Sniff  It has a citrusy aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale is has an orange flavor and an odd vanilla taste.  There is almost a sour finish. 
4. Another Look  This is ale looks good with its long lasting head and good lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this pale ale is not good.  It has a variety of undesirable flavors and tastes.  I would not recommend this pale ale to anyone.

1. Look  A hazy deep gold IPA that pours a average white head.
2. Sniff  This IPA has a very citrusy aroma.
3. Sip  This medium bodied ale has a mildly bitter initial taste followed by a bold bitter finish.  It also has an orange like flavor and taste with a long lasting finish.  
4. Another Look  This is IPA looks average with good lacing and lots of bubbles.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this hoppy ale is just that very hoppy.  It has a big bitter finish, but not much else.  I would not recommend this IPA to family or friends only to hop heads looking for a intense bitter IPA.

1. Look  A hazy amber-brown ale that looks very tasty and pours a big off white head.
2. Sniff  It has a pleasant roasted malt nose with a delicate hop aroma.
3. Sip  This full bodied ale has a roasted malty flavor that is balanced with just the right amount of hops.  It also has a slight grassy taste and a soft bitter finish.
4. Another Look  This is a good looking ale.  It has a lot of sediment, a long lasting head, and solid lacing.  
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is well-balanced ale offers many flavors.  I enjoyed the roasted malt taste and the delicate bitter finish.  This very drinkable ale, would appeal to the average beer drinker.  It has a long lasting malty finish that will keep any beer drinker interested.  I would definitely recommend this ale to family and friends.

1. Look  A clear pale amber IPA with a nice white head.
2. Sniff  Hoppy Boy has citrusy aroma with a piney nose as well.
3. Sip  A medium bodied ale with a piney grapefruit finish.  It is has a pleasant dry finish that it somewhat long lasting.    
4. Another Look  Great lacing and a very attractive color.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this a a very tasty IPA that has a great piney grapefruit finish.  This is a very appealing IPA that non-IPA drinkers would enjoy.  I would absolutely recommend this IPA to family and friends.

1. Look - A clear pale amber pale ale with an average white head.
2. Sniff  This pale ale has a roasted malt aroma with a subtle grassy nose.
3. Sip  This is medium bodied ale has a small roasted malt flavor and a soft bitter finish.     
4. Another Look  This pale ale has a long lasting head and good lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a malty pale ale that is has a grassy flavor but is easy to drink.  I wouldnt recommend this pale ale to my family and friends.

1. Look - A clear pale amber IPA with an excellent white head.
2. Sniff  This Ruination IPA has a deep malty carmel aroma with a big piney hop nose.
3. Sip  Initially, there is an instant bitterness followed by an alcohol finish.  This is a strong medium bodied IPA packed with an abundance of flavor and taste.    
4. Another Look  Ruination has a very long lasting head with exceptional lacing.  This ale is very appealing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, Ruination is a well balanced IPA.  It has a sweet malty flavor balanced with a striking bitter finish.  This is an excellent IPA that pushes the boundaries of the style.  I would only recommend this IPA to family and friends who are long time IPA drinkers.

1. Look - A pale amber IPA with a nice big white head and good carbonation. 
2. Sniff  There is soft honey and oak aroma.  There are also some piney hop notes.
3. Sip  This IPA is medium bodied ale that has a bold oak flavor and smooth finish.  This is a very easy drinking IPA with a unique oak taste.  This IPA has a noticeable citrus front and a very soft bitter finish.  
4. Another Look  This IPA has a average lacing and looks tasty.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a interesting take on the IPA style.  It offers a unique twist with its oak flavor a soft bitterness.  This would be a excellent way to introduce friends and family to the IPA style it is very easy to drink and full of flavor.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob:
1. Look - A hazy pale gold IPA with a big white head and lots of bubbles.
2. Sniff  There is a fruity nose and citrus aroma.
3. Sip  This is a light bodied IPA that is citrus flavor at first with a mild bitter finish.   
4. Another Look  This beer looks like easy drinking ale with a long lasting head and solid lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a very refreshing ale that has a citrus aroma and taste.  I would absolutely recommend this to family and friends it is very drinkable.  This is a quality fresh hopped IPA.
beer_name: Port Brewing High Tide  Fresh Hop IPA

review_blob:
1. Look - A deep amber color with an off white head that is average. 
2. Sniff  There is a pleasant aroma of malt, rye, and hops.
3. Sip  This IPA is medium bodied ale that is has a mild spice and dry bitter finish.  Hop Rod Rye could easily substitute a meal.  There is a long lasting flavor of hops and rye.  
4. Another Look  This beer is very appealing.  It has a good lacing and a nice deep amber color.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a big ale. It has a very pleasant dry bitter finish and loaded taste and flavor including a floral hop aroma and hints of caramel.  I would absolutely recommend this to family and friends it is very drinkable.
beer_name: Bear Republic Hop Rod Rye Ale

review_blob:
1. Look  Undercover Investigation Shut-down is very clear and is amber-brown color ale that is very clear with a nice off white head. 
2. Sniff  There is a malty aroma.
3. Sip  This IPA is full-bodied ale with a smooth bitter finish.  This ale is well balance with a nice malty flavor and taste.    
4. Another Look  The beer looks very good with average lacing.  Its deep amber color is very appealing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is full-bodied ale that is well balanced.  It has a very enjoyable long lasting malty taste.  I would recommend this ale to intermediate craft beer fans.  I would purchase this ale again.

1. Look  A hazy straw color wheat ale with a medium white head and steady amount of bubbles.
2. Sniff  There is a big citrus nose with a strong lemon aroma.
3. Sip  This IPA is light bodied ale that is fruity from start to finish.  It has a long lasting finish that is very tasty.  It is very similar to the taste of a regular piece of bubblegum.
4. Another Look  The beer looks average with weak lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, an interesting wheat ale, with a very unique flavor and taste.  I would recommend this wheat ale to family and friends especially in the summer months.  This is a easy drinking and fun ale to drink.

1. Look  This Imperial IPA has a medium amber color with a big off-white head and lots of bubbles. 
2. Sniff  There nose is citrusy.
3. Sip  This medium bodied Imperial IPA has a very unpleasant bitter taste.  It has a very bitter dry taste.  There really is not much flavor to this ale other than the overwhelming bitterness from start to finish.   
4. Another Look  The beer looks average and has a long lasting head.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this Imperial IPA that lacks flavor and taste.  It is not a beer I would recommend to anyone.  I could have purchased a skunked bottle.  However, I dont believe that to be the case.
